title: Apple Cinnamon Cake
ingredients:
1 (18.25 oz.) pkg. spice or cake mix 
  1 (21 oz.) can apple pie filling 
  3 eggs 
  3 Tbsp. sugar 
  1 tsp. ground cinnamon
preparation:
Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. 
  Blend together cake mix 
  pie filling and eggs in a large mixer bowl. 
  Beat at medium speed for 2 minutes. 
  Combine sugar and cinnamon. 
  Spread half the batter in greased 13 x 9-inch pan; sprinkle with half the cinnamon-sugar. Repeat with remaining batter and cinnamon-sugar. 
  Bake 30 to 35 minutes 
  until wooden pick inserted in center of cake comes out clean. 
  Cool. 
  Makes 12 servings. 
  Preparation time: 10 minutes. Bake time: 35 minutes.

title: Black Bottom Banana Bars
ingredients:
1/2 c. butter or margarine 
  1 c. sugar 
  1 egg 
  1 tsp. vanilla extract 
  1 1/2 c. mashed ripe bananas (about 3 medium) 
  1 1/2 c. flour 
  1 tsp. baking powder 
  1 tsp. baking soda 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/4 c. baking cocoa
preparation:
In mixing bowl 
  cream butter and sugar. 
  Add egg and vanilla; beat until thoroughly combined. 
  Blend in the bananas. 
  Combine the flour 
  baking powder 
  baking soda and salt. 
  Add to creamed mixture and mix well. 
  Divide batter in half. 
  Add cocoa to half. 
  Spread into a greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. 
  Spoon remaining batter on top and swirl with a knife. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes 
  or until the bars test done. 
  Cool. 
  Yields 2 1/2 to 3 dozen.

title: Tuna Ball
ingredients:
2 (7 oz.) cans white tuna 
  drained 
  8 oz. fat-free cream cheese 
  1 tsp. horseradish 
  2 Tbsp. grated onion 
  1 tsp. lemon juice 
  about 1/3 c. chopped pecans
preparation:
Mix all ingredients 
  except pecans. 
  Chill 
  then roll into ball. 
  Roll ball in chopped pecans.

title: Marinated Steak
ingredients:
1 thick flank steak or London broil (about 1 1/2 lb.) 
  2/3 c. dry red wine 
  1 Tbsp. soy sauce 
  1/8 tsp. oregano 
  crumbled 
  1/8 tsp. marjoram 
  crumbled 
  freshly ground black pepper
preparation:
Mix together the wine 
  soy sauce and seasonings. 
  Place the steak in a long glass baking dish and pour the marinade over the meat. 
  Cover and chill at least 12 to 18 hours 
  turning the meat over once or twice. 
  Preheat the broiler. 
  Remove the steak from the marinade. 
  Pat dry and broil 4-inches from the heat for about 5 minutes on each side. 
  To serve 
  cut thin slices diagonally across the grain. 
  Serve with rice.

title: County Kitchen Chicken Pie
ingredients:
2 1/2 lb. to 3 lb. fryer 
  1 can undiluted cream of chicken soup 
  1/2 tsp. black pepper 
  1 c. buttermilk 
  2 c. reserved chicken broth 
  1 stick melted margarine 
  1 c. self-rising flour 
  1 tsp. salt
preparation:
Cook chicken until tender. 
  Remove meat from bones. 
  Reserve broth; cut chicken into small pieces and place in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. 
  In a saucepan 
  mix and bring to a boil the reserved broth and soup. 
  In another bowl 
  combine margarine 
  pepper 
  salt 
  flour and buttermilk. 
  Mix thoroughly to form batter. 
  Pour broth mixture over chicken. 
  Spoon batter over top. 
  Bake at 425\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes.

title: Citron Preserves
ingredients:
2 bowls citron (strips may be 1/4-inch thick) 
  1 bowl sugar 
  1 large can crushed pineapple
preparation:
Peel citron; cut into strips. 
  Rinse in water 
  pick up and put in preserving pan (leave the water in preserving pan that drains from rind). 
  Mix sugar with rind. 
  When sugar dissolves on low heat 
  you will have just about a pan full. 
  Add pineapple. 
  Cook until mixture is of preserving consistency.

title: Creole Red Bean Salad
ingredients:
1 c. celery 
  chopped 
  1 c. onions 
  chopped 
  1/2 c. dill pickle 
  chopped 
  2 (1 lb.) cans red beans 
  2 to 4 Tbsp. mayonnaise 
  1 tsp. salt 
  2 hard-boiled eggs 
  chopped
preparation:
Drain and rinse beans. 
  Mix all ingredients. 
  Great with barbecue!

title: Chicken And Vegetable Casserole
ingredients:
2 to 3 small cans canned chicken 
  4 oz. Cheez Whiz 
  1 can Veg-All 
  drained 
  1 undiluted can cream of chicken soup
preparation:
Mix Cheez Whiz and soup together. 
  Add chicken 
  then Veg-All. Pour into casserole dish. Crush 1 tube Ritz crackers and melt 1/4 stick margarine. 
  Toss together and put on top. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

title: Spinach Cornbread
ingredients:
1 pkg. Jiffy cornbread mix 
  2 eggs 
  3/4 c. melted butter or margarine 
  1 finely chopped small onion 
  6 oz. carton cottage cheese 
  1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach 
  thawed and drained
preparation:
Melt margarine in pie plate. 
  Mix all ingredients well and pour into pan. 
  Bake at 400\u00b0 for 1 hour.

title: Asparagus And Cheese Sauce
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. butter 
  2 Tbsp. flour 
  1 c. milk 
  salt and pepper to taste 
  3/4 c. grated sharp cheese 
  2 whole pimentos 
  cut fine 
  2 c. cooked asparagus
preparation:
Melt butter; add flour. 
  Add milk to make sauce. 
  Add cheese 
  pimentos and asparagus. 
  Salt and pepper to taste. 
  Server on toast.

title: Creamed Asparagus And Mushrooms
ingredients:
3 lb. fresh or frozen asparagus 
  1 lb. mushrooms 
  3 Tbsp. butter 
  1 Tbsp. minced onion 
  1/2 Tbsp. flour 
  1 c. heavy cream 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/2 tsp. pepper 
  dash of nutmeg 
  paprika
preparation:
Remove stems from mushrooms. 
  Wipe caps and slice. 
  Saute mushrooms in butter with onion until golden. 
  Prepare asparagus (cooked) as usual; cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces. 
  Heat 1 tablespoon butter and blend in flour. 
  When lightly browned 
  add cream. 
  Heat slowly 
  stirring occasionally 
  until thickened. 
  Season with salt 
  pepper and nutmeg. 
  Add sauteed mushrooms and onion; keep warm. Drain asparagus; place in dish. 
  Top with mushroom sauce. 
  Add a sprinkle of paprika 
  if desired. 
  Serves 8.

title: Molded Pineapple Salad
ingredients:
1 pkg. lime jello 
  2 c. boiling water 
  1/2 c. grated mild Cheddar cheese 
  1/2 c. Dream Whip 
  1 c. crushed pineapple 
  drained
preparation:
Dissolve 
  jello 
  in boiling water. 
  Chill until mixture begins to thicken 
  and 
  is 
  firm 
  to touch (1 to 1 1/2 hours). Whip jello until fluffy. 
  Fold in remaining ingredients. 
  Pour into mold or baking dish.

title: Easy Butterscotch Pecans Rolls
ingredients:
1 stick margarine 
  1/2 c. pecans 
  1 pkg. (24) frozen hot rolls 
  1 pkg. butterscotch pudding (not instant) 
  1 c. brown sugar 
  1 tsp. cinnamon
preparation:
Melt margarine in small pan and set aside. 
  Grease 9 x 12-inch pan and sprinkle pecans over the bottom. 
  Arrange frozen rolls in pan over nuts 
  4 across and 6 down. 
  Sprinkle pudding (dry) over rolls. 
  Sprinkle cinnamon and brown sugar mix over top. 
  Pour melted margarine over the rolls. 
  Let stand overnight covered with wax paper. 
  In the morning 
  bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. 
  Turn upside down on cookie sheet.

title: Orange Peel Cup
ingredients:
oranges 
  egg or hamburger
preparation:
Cut one 
  orange in half 
  remove and eat the pulp. 
  Fill the cavity 
  with an egg or hamburger. 
  Place on a bed of coals and cook until done.

title: Bie-Rocks Or Beuroc
ingredients:
1 lb. hamburger 
  2 c. onion 
  chopped 
  3 c. cabbage 
  shredded 
  hot roll dough 
  1/4 tsp. pepper 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  2 Tbsp. butter
preparation:
Brown hamburger and onion. 
  Remove from pan. 
  In butter (if needed) cook cabbage until wilted. 
  Add hamburger 
  onion 
  salt and pepper. 
  Mix well. 
  Cool. 
  Roll dough into 9-inch square. 
  Place 3 tablespoons of meat mixture in center. 
  Fold corners together. Place folded sides down. 
  Place in a warm place to rise. 
  Bake in a 350\u00b0 oven until brown.
cooking_style: The cooking style for this recipe is baked.

title: Pearl Street'S Chicken And Broccoli
ingredients:
5 oz. butter 
  2 Tbsp. crushed garlic in oil 
  2 tsp. chopped parsley 
  1 oz. white wine 
  8 oz. boneless chicken breast 
  cut into strips 
  4 oz. broccoli spears 
  3 oz. roasted red peppers in strips 
  8 oz. rotini 
  cooked
preparation:
Cut broccoli in 1-inch pieces. 
  Heat butter 
  garlic and parsley. 
  Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. 
  Add wine and chicken. Continue cooking over medium heat. 
  When chicken is almost done 
  add broccoli. 
  Cook a few minutes more 
  stirring often 
  then add peppers. 
  Serve over hot 
  cooked rotini. 
  Serves 2.

title: Ingrid'S Gingersnaps
ingredients:
1/2 c. dark Karo syrup 
  1/2 c. sugar 
  1/6 lb. butter (80 gr) 
  8 Tbsp. whipping cream 
  2 c. flour 
  2 tsp. baking powder 
  1/2 tsp. pepper 
  1/2 tsp. ginger 
  1 tsp. cinnamon 
  1 tsp. cloves
preparation:
Heat syrup 
  sugar 
  butter and cream to boiling. 
  Cool. 
  Add remaining ingredients and let stand overnight. 
  Roll out very thin. Cut into diamond shape and brush with egg whites and a split almond on the top. 
  Bake at 325\u00b0 for 10 to 12 minutes 
  approximately. Watch closely as they burn easily.

title: Poached Fish(Microwave)
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. chopped onion 
  1 Tbsp. butter 
  2 Tbsp. dry white wine 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/4 tsp. sugar 
  1/2 tsp. tarragon 
  dash of pepper 
  1 lb. fillets (trout excellent) 
  8 oz. sliced fresh mushrooms
preparation:
Place onion and butter in 12 x 8-inch baking dish. 
  Microwave on High 1 to 1 1/2 minutes until onion is transparent. 
  Stir in wine 
  salt 
  sugar 
  tarragon and pepper. 
  Add fillets 
  turning to coat fish well with sauce. 
  Top with mushrooms. 
  Cover with plastic. 
  Microwave at High 6 to 8 minutes or until fish flakes. Rotate and spoon sauce over fish at 1/2 cooking time.

title: Date Strips
ingredients:
2 eggs 
  well beaten 
  1 pkg. pitted dates 
  separated into halves 
  1 c. sugar 
  2 tsp. baking powder 
  1/4 tsp. salt (optional) 
  1 c. flour (not sifted) 
  1/2 c. boiling water 
  3/4 to 1 c. chopped walnuts 
  2 Tbsp. melted butter or margarine or lo-fat Crisco oil 
  2 tsp. vanilla
preparation:
To eggs 
  add all other ingredients 
  except only add half of package of dates. 
  Pour batter in 9 x 13-inch pan; press rest of dates evenly on top of batter in the pan. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes. 
  Sprinkle with confectioners sugar; cut into strips when cool.

title: Soy Baked Chicken
ingredients:
2/3 c. soy sauce 
  2/3 c. fruit juice 
  1/2 c. beef bouillon 
  1 clove garlic 
  minced 
  1 tsp. powdered ginger 
  2 medium chicken fryers 
  cut into serving pieces
preparation:
Blend soy sauce 
  fruit juice 
  undiluted bouillon 
  garlic and ginger. 
  Pour over chicken. 
  Cover and marinate 1 hour. 
  Remove chicken pieces from sauce and arrange in large oblong baking pan. Bake in 325\u00b0 oven for 1 hour 
  basting chicken about every 15 minutes with some of the remaining marinade. 
  Serves 6 to 8.

title: Seasoned Green Beans
ingredients:
1 (16 oz.) can cut green beans 
  1 packet beef bouillon 
  2 Tbsp. chopped onions 
  1 can water
preparation:
Open can of green beans. 
  Put in saucepan. 
  Add 1 can water 
  onion and beef bouillon. 
  Bring to boil. 
  Lower heat and cook for about 1 hour. 
  Liquid should be almost cooked away. 
  Serves 2.
price: I would estimate the cost of this recipe to be a 1.

title: Baked Moist Pork Chops
ingredients:
loin pork chops (1 per person 
  1/2-inch thick) 
  trimmed of fat 
  apples 
  halved and cored (not peeled) 
  onions 
  sliced 1/2-inch thick 
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
Use casserole dish with cover and large enough to accommodate chops. Place halved apples 
  skin-peel side down 
  enough to cover bottom of dish. 
  Salt and pepper chops. 
  Arrange over apples. Place onion slices over chops. 
  Cover.

title: Pork Chops Dijon
ingredients:
4 pork chops 
  2 Tbsp. Italian dressing 
  2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard 
  1/4 tsp. black pepper 
  1 small sliced onion
preparation:
In a small bowl combine salad dressing 
  mustard and pepper. Brush mixture on both sides of chops. 
  In a skillet 
  cook chops on medium for 20 minutes. 
  Turn chops and add onion rings. 
  Cook for 5 to 10 minutes.

title: Chili Con Queso Cheese Dip
ingredients:
1 lb. ground beef 
  1/2 c. chopped onion 
  1 c. velveeta cheese 
  10 oz. diced tomatoes & green chilies 
  1 can evaporated milk 
  2 tbsp. chili powder
preparation:
Brown ground beef and drain. 
  Put all ingredients into crock pot and let simmer until cheese melts.

title: Mother'S Broccoli And Rice
ingredients:
1 c. raw rice 
  1 c. chopped celery 
  1 c. chopped onion 
  1 small jar Cheez Whiz 
  1 can cream of chicken soup 
  1 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli 
  3/4 stick butter
preparation:
Cook rice. 
  Cook broccoli according to package directions. Set aside. 
  Saute celery and onion in 3/4 stick of butter. Combine all ingredients in casserole dish. 
  Bake 1 hour at 350\u00b0 covered.

title: Pronto Spanish Rice
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. margarine 
  1 envelope tomato-onion soup mix 
  2 1/4 c. water 
  1 medium green pepper 
  1 c. uncooked rice
preparation:
Chop green pepper finely. 
  In medium saucepan 
  melt butter and cook green pepper until tender. 
  Stir in tomato-onion soup mix blended with water. 
  Bring to a boil. 
  Stir in uncooked rice and simmer 
  covered 
  20 minutes or until rice is done (tender).

title: Red And White Salad
ingredients:
2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese 
  softened 
  1 pkg. miniature marshmallows 
  1 pkg. lemon jello 
  2 (4 oz.) pkg. whipping cream 
  1 can crushed pineapple 
  1 small jar cherries 
  quartered 
  1 c. chopped pecans
preparation: Mix and pour into 9 x 13 pan. Chill until firm. Mix 1 package cherry jello and pour over salad. Chill until firm.
cooking_style: No cooking style is indicated in the given recipe.

title: Chicken Spinach Parmesan
ingredients:
1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese 
  1/2 tsp. oregano 
  3 whole 
  boneless 
  skinless chicken breasts 
  halved lengthwise 
  1/2 c. sliced green onion 
  1/4 c. margarine 
  2 Tbsp. flour 
  1 c. low-fat milk 
  10 oz. pkg. frozen chopped spinach 
  thawed and drained
preparation:
Combine Parmesan cheese and oregano in small bowl. 
  Roll chicken in mixture. 
  Set aside remaining. 
  Arrange pieces in a 13 x 9-inch dish.

title: Grammie'S Biscuits
ingredients:
4 c. flour 
  2 well rounded tsp. cream of tartar 
  1 tsp. baking soda 
  1 tsp. salt 
  3 Tbsp. shortening 
  heaped up 
  1 1/4 c. milk
preparation:
Sift dry ingredients together 4 times. 
  Mix in shortening 
  breaking it up with a fork. 
  Stir in milk to form a ball. 
  Roll out on floured board 
  not too thin 
  about 1/2 to 3/4-inch thick. Cut with a biscuit cutter and place biscuits 
  not touching each other 
  on ungreased baking sheet. 
  Bake 15 to 20 minutes at 450\u00b0.

title: Pea Pickin Cake
ingredients:
1 box yellow cake mix 
  4 eggs 
  1 can mandarin oranges 
  1/2 c. oil
preparation:
Preheat oven to 325\u00b0. 
  Put all ingredients in mixing bowl and mix well. 
  Pour into four 9-inch cake pans and bake at 325\u00b0 in oven for 20 minutes.

title: Wine Jelly
ingredients:
2 c. Claret or Burgundy 
  3 c. sugar 
  1/2 bottle liquid fruit pectin
preparation:
Mix wine and sugar in top of a double boiler. 
  Place over rapidly boiling water 
  stirring constantly 
  until sugar dissolves 
  about 2 minutes. 
  Remove from heat and 
  at once 
  stir in pectin. Pour quickly into hot sterilized glasses. 
  Skim 
  if necessary. Cover at once with 1/2-inch hot paraffin.

title: Nine Egg Pound Cake
ingredients:
3 c. sugar 
  6 sticks Miracle Whip margarine 
  9 eggs 
  3 c. flour 
  1 tsp. vanilla extract 
  1 tsp. lemon extract 
  1 tsp. almond extract
preparation:
Heat oven to 325\u00b0. 
  Grease and flour tube pan. 
  Cream sugar and margarine 
  about 10 minutes. 
  Add eggs 
  one at a time 
  beating well. 
  Mix in flour. 
  Beat good. 
  Add flavorings. 
  Pour into tube pan and bake approximately 1 hour and 25 minutes. 
  Have eggs and margarine at room temperature.

title: Shrimp Mozambique
ingredients:
1/3 c. olive oil 
  2 tsp. butter 
  3 cloves minced garlic 
  1/4 c. chopped parsley 
  2 to 3 Goya chili peppers 
  1 pinch Assafroa or saffron* 
  1 lb. medium-large shrimp 
  peeled and deveined 
  juice of 1/2 orange 
  1/4 c. dry white wine
preparation:
In a large 
  heavy skillet combine oil 
  butter 
  garlic 
  parsley 
  chili peppers and Assafroa over high heat until butter melts and garlic sizzles. 
  Add shrimp and stir briskly until nearly done. 
  Add juice and wine; toss a few more times and remove from heat. 
  Drizzle pan sauces over 3 to 4 shrimp in a shallow dish and serve with fresh Portuguese bread for dipping and a crisp 
  new white wine. 
  (This recipe also works very well substituting fresh 
  whole 
  scrubbed littlenecks for the shrimp.)

title: Smoked Pork Chops Casserole
ingredients:
6 c. sliced potatoes 
  1 c. peeled sliced apples 
  1 c. grated Swiss cheese 
  6 pork chops 
  smoked 
  1 Tbsp. diced onion
preparation:
Boil potatoes until just tender (about 10 minutes). 
  Grease 9 x 13-inch baking pan. 
  Combine potatoes 
  apples and onion and spoon into pan. 
  Sprinkle cheese on top. 
  Sear pork chops over high heat. Place chops over potatoes and cover lightly with foil. 
  Bake 30 minutes. 
  Uncover the dish and bake an additional 30 minutes. 
  One and 1/2 hours total time.

title: Tipsy Pork Chops
ingredients:
4 loin or chump pork chops 
  1 onion 
  1/2 pt. cider (approximately) 
  2 cooking apples 
  pinch of mixed herbs 
  1 tsp. made mustard 
  1 Tbsp. flour 
  2 oz. butter
preparation:
Melt butter and fry chops on both sides. 
  Remove and spread the mustard on one side. 
  Keep warm. 
  In the remaining butter and juices from the chops 
  fry the chopped onion and stir in the flour. Add the herbs and cider and cook until the sauce thickens. 
  Place the sliced apples in a casserole and pour the sauce on top of them. Place the chops on top and brown in the oven at 350\u00b0 or gas mark 4 for 25 minutes.

title: Cookies And Ice Cream Sandwich
ingredients:
1 large pkg. Oreo cookies 
  1 1/2 gal. Blue Bell peppermint ice cream 
  1 stick butter
preparation:
Melt butter in pan. 
  Crush Oreos and add to melted butter. Mix until frosting on cookies melt in with the butter. 
  Spread 1/2 cookie mix on bottom of cake pan and top with softened ice cream. Spread remaining cookie mixture on top of ice cream. 
  Freeze for 1 hour and serve in cut squares.

title: Strawberry Pretzel Jello
ingredients:
2 c. lightly crushed pretzels 
  1 (6 oz.) pkg. strawberry jello 
  2 c. boiling water 
  3/4 c. melted margarine 
  1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese (lite) 
  1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip (lite) 
  2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen sliced strawberries 
  1 c. sugar 
  3 Tbsp. sugar
preparation:
Mix together the pretzels 
  margarine and 3 tablespoons sugar. Press into a 9 x 13-inch pan. 
  Bake at 400\u00b0 for 8 minutes. 
  Let cool completely.

title: Chocolate Royale Cheesecake
ingredients:
18 Oreo Chocolate sandwich cookies 
  finely crushed 
  2 Tbsp. butter 
  melted
preparation:
Mix crumbs and butter; press onto bottom of 9-inch spring form pan. 
  Bake at 325\u00b0 for 10 minutes.

title: Sally'S Peach Or Apricot Cobbler
ingredients:
6 c. peaches or apricots 
  1 c. sugar 
  1/3 c. tapioca 
  dash of two of almond flavoring 
  if desired 
  pastry topping (your favorite)
preparation:
Wash fruit 
  peel and slice peaches. 
  Apricots do not need to be peeled 
  just sliced. 
  Mix together sugar and tapioca to blend and place over sliced fruit that has been placed in a large bowl. Allow to stand about 5 minutes for sugar mixture to blend well. Place fruit in baking pans (large or small) and may be frozen at this stage (covered well with foil of course and sprinkled with a bit fresh to prevent discoloration) or if you wish to bake at this time 
  cover with prepared pastry 
  slit pastry several times and bake at 400\u00b0 for about 40 to 50 minutes 
  watching carefully not to overbrown. 
  Since all ovens are different it is a good idea to lower temperature if the pastry crust is getting too dark. 
  Fruit should be bubbling and crust golden brown when ready. 
  Serve warm or cold with low-fat ice milk ice cream.

title: Robust Chili
ingredients:
2 lb. ground chuck 
  1 small onion 
  1 pkg. taco seasoning 
  1 (4 oz.) can green chilies 
  5 cans chili beans 
  1 can diced tomatoes 
  1 can Manwich 
  1 jar chunky salsa
preparation:
Brown meat and onion. 
  Drain and rinse. 
  In large pot combine all ingredients. 
  Simmer and serve.

title: Cereal Mix(Low-Fat)
ingredients:
1 pkg. Sun-Maid fruit bits 
  2/3 c. nuts (almonds 
  walnuts and/or pecans) 
  1/2 c. old-fashioned oats (uncooked) 
  1/2 (12 oz.) box corn flakes 
  1/2 (22 oz.) box bran flakes
preparation:
Combine fruit bits 
  nuts and oats in small bowl. 
  Layer corn flakes 
  bran flakes and nut mixture in sealable container 
  such as a Rubbermaid Cereal Keeper. 
  Serve with skim milk. 
  Makes 10 servings.

title: Lemon Torte Cake
ingredients:
40 single Waverly crackers 
  1 stick margarine 
  melted and poured over crushed crackers 
  4 egg whites 
  1 c. sugar 
  2 cans Comstock lemon pie filling 
  1 (16 oz.) Cool Whip
preparation:
Melt margarine over crackers. 
  Spread evenly in a 9 x 13-inch pan. 
  Beat egg whites and sugar until stiff. 
  Spread evenly over crushed crackers. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes. 
  Let cool. Top with pie filling. 
  Spread Cool Whip on top of lemon pie filling. 
  Keep refrigerated until ready to use.

title: Cheese Twirls
ingredients:
1/2 lb. Mexican pasteurized process cheese spread with jalapeno pepper 
  1 (8 oz.) softened cream cheese 
  2 Tbsp. chopped pitted ripe olives 
  1 Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
preparation:
Roll process cheese spread between two pieces of wax paper to form a 9 x 12-inch rectangle. 
  Beat cream cheese 
  olives and cilantro until well blended. 
  Spread over process cheese spread. Roll up starting at narrow side to form 9-inch roll. 
  Garnish with additional cilantro 
  if desired. 
  Chill 
  covered 
  until firm. Serve with assorted crackers.

title: Polish Mistake
ingredients:
1 lb. hot sausage 
  1 lb. ground meat 
  1/2 tsp. garlic powder 
  1/2 tsp. oregano 
  1/2 tsp. Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce 
  1 lb. Velveeta cheese
preparation:
Brown sausage and meat separately and drain well. 
  Mix well with remaining ingredients until cheese melts. 
  Refrigerate. 
  After chilled 
  spread on rye bread and bake 15 minutes at 350\u00b0. 
  This can also be heated and served with crackers or party bread.

title: Cinnamon Punch
ingredients:
3 Tbsp. small red cinnamon candy 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1/2 c. water 
  1 can red regular or low calorie Hawaiian Punch 
  chilled 
  1 qt. ginger ale 
  chilled 
  2 lemons 
  thinly sliced
preparation:
Combine the sugar 
  candy and water together until candy is melted. 
  Just before serving 
  add the ginger ale.

title: The Ruby Slipper
ingredients:
1 pkg. yellow cake mix or pudding included cake mix 
  1 c. (1/2 pt.) sour cream 
  1/4 c. water 
  2 eggs 
  1 (3 oz.) pkg. jello-brand raspberry flavored gelatin
preparation:
Combine cake mix 
  sour cream 
  water and eggs in a large bowl. Blend 
  then beat at medium speed for 2 minutes until creamy. Spoon 1/3 of batter into well-greased and floured 10-inch fluted tube pan. 
  Sprinkle with 1/2 the gelatin. 
  Repeat layers. 
  Spread remaining batter over gelatin to cover. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 to 50 minutes 
  until cake springs back when lightly pressed. 
  Cool in pan for 5 minutes. 
  Remove from pan 
  cool on rack. 
  Sprinkle with confectioners sugar 
  if desired.

title: "Pretend" Orange Julius
ingredients:
2 c. orange juice 
  1/2 c. milk 
  1/2 c. water 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1/2 tsp. vanilla 
  2 heaping Tbsp. Secret Mix 
  6 to 8 ice cubes
preparation:
Combine orange juice 
  milk 
  water 
  sugar 
  vanilla 
  Secret Mix and ice cubes in blender container. 
  Blend until mixed but ice crystals remain. 
  Serve immediately.

title: Omelet In A Bag
ingredients:
1 egg 
  1 Ziploc Baggie
preparation:
Prepare whatever you like in your omelet. 
  Boil a half pan of water. 
  Scramble only one egg. 
  Put egg and all of your ingredients in your Ziploc Baggie. 
  Hold Ziploc in the pan of boiling water until omelet is firm. 
  Remove omelet from Baggie. Only use one egg because it wouldn't get done and Baggie will melt.

title: Spiced Apples And Sweet Potatoes
ingredients:
8 large apples (preferably Yellow Delicious) 
  3 medium sized sweet potatoes 
  10 dates 
  chopped finely 
  1/2 c. raisins 
  6 oz. can apple juice concentrate 
  2 tsp. cinnamon powder 
  1/2 tsp. nutmeg 
  1/2 tsp. allspice 
  vanilla extract (1 1/2 Tbsp.) 
  6 oz. coarsely chopped almonds
preparation:
Peel and thinly slice the apples. 
  Peel and grate the sweet potatoes. 
  Pour apple juice concentrate into a stainless steel Dutch oven. 
  Add apples and sweet potatoes and cook over low flame until tender 
  but not mushy. 
  Stir in dates and raisins to heat through. 
  Add spices to taste. 
  Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. 
  Place all in a casserole. 
  Lightly toast almonds on a baking sheet under broiler. 
  Cover entire top of casserole with the nuts.

title: Great Zucchini Relish
ingredients:

  4 onions 
  ground

  ground 
  1 red pepper 
  ground

preparation:
Combine zucchini

  Seal in hot sterilized jars.

title: Lentil-Spinach Soup
ingredients:
8 c. chicken stock or 48 oz. can stock 
  2 cloves chopped garlic 
  1 onion 
  chopped 
  3/4 c. chopped carrots 
  1 c. chopped celery 
  1 c. lentils 
  1 bunch spinach 
  3 Tbsp. lemon juice or vinegar

preparation:
Wash and pick over lentils.

  Cover; let sit 1 hour and drain. 
  (This removes gas.)

title: Onion-Tuna Quiche
ingredients:
2 beaten eggs 
  1 tall can evaporated milk 
  1 c. shredded Cheddar 
  1 (6 1/2 oz.) can drained tuna 
  3 Tbsp. minced onion 
  1 tsp. garlic salt 
  1 (9-inch) frozen pie shell
preparation:
Mix together the first 6 ingredients and pour into pie shell. Bake at 450\u00b0 for 15 minutes. 
  Lower oven temperature to 350\u00b0 and bake 30 minutes longer or until top is browned. 
  Let stand 15 minutes before serving. 
  Serves 6 to 8.

title: Tamale Corn Casserole
ingredients:
2 eggs (beaten) 
  3/4 cup cornmeal 
  1/2 teaspoon baking powder 
  1 or 2 cans chopped green chilies 
  2 cans creamed - style corn 
  2/4 teaspoon garlic salt

preparation: Mix together well all ingredients and pour into a casserole dish and bake at 350\u00b0 about one hour or until knife tip inserted in middle comes out clean.

title: Creamy Jello Mold
ingredients:
6 c. Jell-O 
  8 oz. cream cheese 
  1 c. crushed pineapple in juice 
  12 oz. whipped topping (nondairy)
preparation:
Spray your mold lightly with Pam to ensure ease of removal. Cream together the Cool Whip and the cream cheese until smooth. Drain the pineapple 
  reserving juice for use in the Jell-O. 
  Make Jell-O as directed on the boxes (2 large boxes) using only 3/4 amount of water and the reserved juice as part of the cold liquid. Reserve 1 cup Jell-O. 
  Quick chill remaining Jell-O until almost set 
  stirring occasionally.

title: Apple Berry Salsa And Cinnamon Chips
ingredients:
2 medium Granny Smith apples 
  2 kiwi 
  peeled and diced 
  2 Tbsp. packed brown sugar 
  2 Tbsp. apple jelly or apricot jam 
  1/4 tsp. cinnamon 
  1 pt. strawberries 
  1 small orange 
  8 (7 oz.) flour tortillas 
  1 Tbsp. sugar
preparation:
Peel 
  core and slice apples. Coarsely chop apples. Dice strawberries and kiwi. Place fruit in a small bowl. Zest orange to measure 1 teaspoon zest. Juice orange to measure 2 tablespoons juice. Add orange zest 
  juice 
  brown sugar and jelly to fruit mixture. Mix gently. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Spoon into serving bowl. Serve with Baked Cinnamon Chips.

title: Legendary Colorado Crab Rounds
ingredients:
1 c. mayonnaise 
  1/2 c. minced scallions 
  1 c. shredded Cheddar 
  6 drops Tabasco 
  1/4 tsp. curry powder 
  1 (6 oz.) can crab meat or equivalent fresh crab 
  2 French baguettes 
  sliced 1/2-inch thick
preparation:
In medium bowl 
  combine mayonnaise 
  scallions 
  cheese 
  Tabasco 
  curry powder and crab. 
  To serve 
  place mixture on bread rounds and broil until golden. 
  Serve immediately.

title: Annie'S Alice Springs Chicken
ingredients:
1 bag boneless skinless thawed chicken breasts 
  1 package provolone cheese slices 
  1 bottle honey dijon salad dressing 
  1 bag cooked bacon pieces
preparation:
Place chicken breasts side by side in a well greased baking dish. 
  Top each breast with one slice of provolone. 
  Sprinkle bacon pieces over provolone slices evenly. 
  Uniformly pour entire bottle of salad dressing over each breast to cover bacon and cheese. 
  Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. 
  Serve with a slotted spoon.

title: Baked Stuffed Quahogs(Ko-Hogs)
ingredients:
12 large cherrystone clams (quahogs) or 1 pt. chopped clams with juice 
  butter 
  1 pkg. stuffing mix 
  lemon 
  salt 
  pepper 
  Durkee's hot sauce 
  dash of sage 
  sherry
preparation:
Wash and rinse clams. 
  Steam in 1 inch boiling water 8 minutes or until all are open. 
  Remove meat; mince coarsely and set aside. Retain water and shells. 
  Make stuffing according to instructions 
  except substitute clam juice for water. 
  Add 1 tablespoon Durkee's hot sauce 
  dash of sage and 1 tablespoon sherry. 
  If using some bought clams and juice 
  add at this time. 
  Salt and pepper to taste.

title: Mystery Cream Cheese Pecan Pie
ingredients:

  1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese 
  softened 
  1/3 c. granulated sugar 
  4 eggs 
  divided 
  2 tsp. vanilla 
  divided 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1 1/4 c. coarsely chopped pecans 
  1 c. golden corn syrup 
  1/4 c. packed brown sugar
preparation:
Prepare pie crust according to package directions for a one crust (9-inch) filled pie. 
  Refrigerate remaining crust for later use. 
  In a small mixing bowl 
  beat cream cheese 
  granulated sugar 
  1 of the eggs 
  1 teaspoon vanilla and salt until smooth. 
  Pour over bottom of prepared crust. 
  Sprinkle pecans over cream cheese layer.

title: Pink Layer Party Cake
ingredients:
1 c. self-rising flour 
  1 c. pink blancmange or pudding powder 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  2 oz. margarine 
  2 dried eggs 
  reconstituted in milk
preparation:
Beat sugar and margarine together. 
  Mix flour and blancmange powder together. 
  Add egg and flour alternately to mixture. 
  Beat well; bake in 2 greased sandwich tins for 20 minutes. 
  When cold 
  spread with layer of jam. 
  To ice 
  boil together 2 tablespoons each sugar and water and small piece of margarine. 
  Allow to cool; beat in sufficient pink blancmange powder to make icing of right colour and consistency. 
  (GE)

title: Cereal Crunch

  salted

preparation:
Mix the cereal and peanuts in large bowl. 
  Melt almond bark and peanut butter. 
  Pour over cereal and peanuts. 
  Mix until all cereal is coated. 
  Drop bite-sized pieces on wax paper with spoon or press into pan and cut into squares.

title: Italian Roast
ingredients:
1 large bottle Italian dressing 
  3 or 4 lb. roast 
  salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
In foil-lined pan 
  place roast in foil. Pour bottle of Italian dressing over roast. Cover and place in oven at 300\u00b0 for 2 to 3 hours.

title: Cream De Cacao Pie
ingredients:
1 qt. coffee ice cream

  1 pt. pistachio

preparation:
Soften coffee ice cream slightly. 
  Pack into pie shell 
  freeze until firm 
  at least 1 hour.

title: Fruit Burst Cookies
ingredients:

  1 c. finely chopped nuts

preparation:
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.

ingredients:

Mix first 5 ingredients

ingredients:

title: Pepper Steak(This Is A Delicious Meat Dish.)
ingredients:

  round steak 
  1 garlic toe 
  chopped

  1 c. water 
  1 onion 
  sliced

  1/4 tsp. ginger 
  1 green pepper 
  chopped 
  1/2 c. diced celery 
  1 Tbsp. cornstarch 
  4 c. cooked rice
preparation:
Mix garlic 
  soy sauce and ginger in a bowl. 
  Cut round steak into strips and soak in mixture for 10 minutes. 
  In a large skillet 
  heat oil and over high heat 
  toss beef until brown. 
  Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. 
  Add tomatoes 
  celery and green pepper; cook 
  tossing once in awhile

title: Pecan Country Chicken

preparation:

title: Hot Burger Potato Baskets

title: Basghetti

preparation:
Make the whole hamburger; cut it up.

  Put grease in pot and put noodles in there. 
  Turn stove on for half an hour and cook noodles. 
  When it's done past the half an hour you can take the noodles out.

Combine all ingredients and mix well; chill. 
  Serve on a platter lined with greens. 
  Makes 4 servings.

title: Hearty Potato Ham Chowder
ingredients:
4 potatoes 
  peeled and diced 
  2 Tbsp. butter or margarine 
  1/4 c. diced onion 
  1/2 c. diced green pepper (optional) 
  2 c. water 
  2 c. diced ham or Spam 
  1 c. whole kernel corn 
  drained 
  1 tsp. salt 
  1/8 tsp. pepper 
  1/4 tsp. paprika 
  3 Tbsp. flour 
  1/3 c. water 
  2 c. milk 
  parsley
preparation:
In large kettle 
  melt margarine or butter; add onion and green pepper and cook until tender. 
  Add potatoes 
  2 cups water and seasonings. 
  Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender. 
  Make paste of flour and 1/3 cup of water and stir into the potato mixture. 
  Add milk and cook until slightly thickened. 
  Stir in corn and ham. 
  Heat thoroughly. 
  Serves 6.

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Sundaes
ingredients:
1/4 c. peanut butter 
  1/2 c. chocolate syrup 
  1 pt. vanilla ice cream
preparation:
Blend peanut butter and chocolate syrup. 
  Divide ice cream among 4 dessert dishes. 
  Spoon sauce over ice cream.

title: 10 O'Clock Rolls
ingredients:
1 1/2 c. milk 
  scalded 
  3/4 tsp. salt 
  2 Tbsp. sugar 
  2 Tbsp. oil 
  1 pkg. yeast 
  3 c. flour
preparation:
Cool milk to lukewarm. 
  Add salt 
  sugar 
  oil 
  yeast and flour. Mix well. 
  Turn out in greased bowl and cover with wax paper. Let rise 1 hour. 
  Roll out on floured board and cut into rolls. Put in greased pan and let rise 1 hour. 
  Bake at 400\u00b0 for 20 minutes.

title: Granny'S Chew Bread
ingredients:
1 (1 lb.) box brown sugar 
  2 c. flour 
  1 stick margarine 
  1 tsp. vanilla 
  3 eggs 
  1/2 to 1 c. pecans 
  1/2 c. coconut (optional)
preparation:
Mix flour and sugar. 
  Add melted margarine and vanilla. 
  Beat eggs and add to flour mixture. 
  Then add pecans and coconut. 
  Pour into greased pan and bake at 325\u00b0 for 30 minutes. 
  Cut into squares.

title: Ellie'S Mexican Salad
ingredients:
1 lb. hamburger 
  browned 
  1 avocado 
  sliced and quartered 
  4 tomatoes 
  chopped 
  1 onion 
  chopped 
  4 oz. Cheddar cheese 
  grated 
  1 (8 oz.) jar French dressing 
  1 head lettuce 
  torn 
  1 (7 to 9 oz.) bag tortilla chips 
  crunched 
  1 can kidney beans 
  drained and rinsed 
  salt to taste
preparation:
Layer ingredients in order listed. 
  Serve at room temperature.

title: Pork Medallions With Vegetables
ingredients:
3/4 lb. pork tenderloin 
  trimmed of fat and cut in 1/2-inch slices 
  1 large 
  thin wedged-cut onion 
  1 c. bite size 
  cut up celery 
  1 c. bite size cut up carrots 
  2 gloves minced garlic 
  1 c. water 
  2 tsp. dried 
  crushed tarragon 
  dash of pepper 
  1 Tbsp. cornstarch 
  1 Tbsp. cold water 
  nonstick cooking spray
preparation:
In medium saucepan 
  combine onion 
  celery 
  carrots 
  garlic 
  1 cup water 
  bouillon cubes 
  tarragon and pepper. 
  Bring to boiling. Reduce heat 
  cover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is not specified.

title: Easy Frozen Corn
ingredients:
4 quarts (12 cups) raw corn cut off cob 
  1 cup sugar 
  1 quart water 
  4 tsp. salt
preparation:
Mix all ingredients. 
  Bring to boil. 
  Simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat 
  cool to room temperature. 
  Refrigerate overnight. Freeze in morning.

title: Tomato Cheese Rice
ingredients:
1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes 
  2 Tbsp. butter 
  1/3 c. water 
  1 1/2 c. Minute rice 
  1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese
preparation:
Combine stewed tomatoes 
  butter and water in saucepan. 
  Bring to a boil. 
  Stir in rice. 
  Cover. 
  Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. 
  Stir in cheese. 
  Makes 4 servings. 
  It is also good without the cheese.

title: One Pot Beef Roast And Gravy
ingredients:
beef roast (your choice) 
  1 pkg. Lipton dry onion soup mix 
  1 can cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup 
  1/2 c. milk 
  2 Tbsp. cornstarch 
  Gravy Master (optional)
preparation:
Place roast in a large baking dish with a cover. Sprinkle roast with dry onion soup mix. In a small bowl 
  add 1/2 cup of water to soup and pour over roast. Cover and bake roast at a low temperature of 200\u00b0 or 250\u00b0 for 3 to 4 hours. Roast will be exceptionally tender. Take roast out of pot and place baking dish on top of stove. Heat the liquid mixture from roast until bubbly.

title: Hardy Hero
ingredients:
1 lb. hamburg 
  1 small onion 
  1/2 c. ketchup 
  garlic salt or powder 
  salt and pepper 
  1 loaf French bread 
  American cheese 
  butter or margarine
preparation:
Slice bread in half; butter both pieces. 
  Mix all other ingredients except cheese; spread mixture on buttered bread. Place bread on cookie sheet lined with aluminum foil. 
  Bake for 20 minutes at 350\u00b0; ten minutes before end of baking 
  place cheese on top of mixture.

title: Glazed Pork Chops With Apples
ingredients:
2 tsp. vegetable oil 
  4 thin pork chops 
  trimmed (1/2-inch thick) 
  2 large Granny Smith apples 
  1 (6 oz.) can frozen unsweetened apple juice concentrate 
  2 tsp. Dijon style mustard 
  1/4 tsp. salt 
  1/8 tsp. pepper
preparation:
Heat oil in medium size skillet over medium heat. 
  Add chops; cook 
  turning occasionally until cooked through 
  8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to warm platter. 
  Pare 
  core and cut apples crosswise into rings 
  about 1/4-inch thick. 
  Add rings to skillet; cook 2 to 3 minutes or until lightly browned. 
  Add apple juice concentrate. Bring to boiling. 
  Stir in mustard 
  salt and pepper. 
  Spoon over chops. 
  Serve with asparagus or sweet potatoes and stuffing.

title: Broccoli And Carrots
ingredients:
1 lb. fresh broccoli 
  1/2 lb. fresh carrots 
  2 Tbsp. butter 
  1 tsp. garlic 
  crushed 
  1/2 tsp. each: black pepper 
  basil and tarragon
preparation:
In pan over high heat 
  steam 1 pound fresh broccoli and 1/2 pound carrots 
  sliced. 
  Steam 10 minutes or until tender. 
  In small pan over medium heat 
  melt butter. 
  Add basil 
  garlic 
  pepper and tarragon; cook 1 minute. 
  Drain broccoli and carrots and pour butter mixture over vegetables. 
  Toss.

title: Garlic-Parmesan Bread
ingredients:
1 1/2 Tbsp. olive oil 
  1 clove garlic 
  minced 
  1 Tbsp. oregano 
  1 1/2 Tbsp. Parmesan 
  grated 
  1 Tbsp. hot water 
  1/2 loaf French bread 
  cut into 4 slices
preparation:
Mix olive oil 
  oregano 
  garlic and water. 
  Spread on French bread and sprinkle with Parmesan. 
  Wrap in foil and heat in oven at 350\u00b0 for 15 minutes.

title: Diabetic Shrimp Chowder
ingredients:
1 (6 oz.) pkg. peeled 
  cooked shrimp 
  2 oz. diced celery 
  2 Tbsp. onion 
  minced 
  2 oz. cooked 
  diced potatoes 
  1 c. skim milk 
  2 Tbsp. butter/oleo 
  salt and pepper
preparation:
Combine shrimp 
  celery and onion in a saucepan with enough water to cover (1 cup). 
  Simmer on low until vegetables are tender. 
  Add potatoes 
  milk and oleo. 
  Heat. 
  Season to taste. Yields 2 servings.

title: Sweet Potato And Apple
ingredients:
3 sweet potatoes 
  4 apples 
  miniature marshmallows 
  3/4 c. sugar 
  1 Tbsp. cornstarch 
  1 tsp. cinnamon
preparation:
Peel and slice potatoes and apples. Put in baking dish a layer of apples and then a layer of potatoes. 
  Cover with marshmallows. Put mix on top of apples and butter. 
  Cover with foil. 
  Bake 1 hour at 350\u00b0.

title: Hay And Gravel Bars
ingredients:
1/4 c. butter 
  1 c. brown sugar 
  1 egg 
  1 c. flour 
  1 tsp. baking powder 
  1/2 c. coconut 
  1/2 c. pecans
preparation:
Melt butter. 
  Stir in brown sugar. 
  Add egg and milk. 
  Stir together flour and baking powder in a small bowl. 
  Stir all ingredients together and mix well. 
  Spread into greased 11 x 17 1/2 x 1 1/2-inch baking pan. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes 
  until toothpick comes out clean.

title: Onion Shortcake Casserole
ingredients:
1/2 c. butter 
  8 oz. shredded cheddar cheese 
  1/4 c. minced fresh dill 
  1 egg 
  14 oz. can cream corn 
  4 drops tabasco sauce 
  2 large onions thinly sliced 
  8 oz. sour cream 
  1/4 tsp. salt 
  1 pkg. Jiffy corn muffin mix 
  1 c. milk
preparation:
Preheat oven to 425\u00b0. 
  Grease a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish. 
  In skillet melt butter and saute onions 5-6 minutes or till soft. Remove from heat and stir in half of the cheddar cheese 
  sour cream 
  dill and salt until combined. 
  In bowl 
  lightly beat egg. Stir in muffin mix 
  cream corn 
  milk and tabasco. 
  Spread into prepared casserole dish. 
  Top with cheese and onion mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar. 
  Bake 35-40 minutes until top is golden.

title: Crunchy Chicken Or Cutlets
ingredients:
8 chicken thighs 
  3 c. corn flakes 
  2 tsp. paprika 
  salt and pepper to taste 
  4 tsp. margarine
preparation:
Remove skin from thighs. 
  Remove bone and fat. 
  Pound meat thin 
  wet chicken. 
  Mix corn flakes 
  paprika and pepper in plastic bag and crush. 
  Coat chicken 
  place on large shallow pan. 
  Pour oil on top of each piece. 
  Bake at 400\u00b0 for about 20 minutes or until done.

title: Old Fashioned Molasses Pudding
ingredients:
1 egg 
  1 c. molasses 
  2/3 c. oil 
  1 c. buttermilk 
  1 tsp. soda 
  1 tsp. baking powder 
  1 tsp. cinnamon 
  1/2 tsp. cloves 
  2 1/2 c. plain flour 
  1/2 c. sugar
preparation: Mix and bake at 325\u00b0 for 45 minutes.

title: Spenny'S Favorite Chicken
ingredients:
1 medium onion 
  chopped 
  2 Tbsp. margarine 
  1 (10 3/4 oz.) can tomato soup 
  2/3 c. beer 
  1 tsp. curry powder 
  1/2 tsp. oregano 
  3 chicken breasts 
  split 
  1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
preparation:
In a saucepan 
  cook onion in margarine until tender. Stir in tomato soup 
  beer 
  curry powder 
  oregano and pepper (dash). Simmer 
  uncovered 
  10 minutes. 
  Arrange chicken breasts in a 9 x 13-inch pan. 
  Pour tomato mixture over chicken. 
  Bake 
  uncovered 
  50 to 55 minutes at 350\u00b0. 
  Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

title: Apple Butter(Delicious On Toast, Pound Cake Or Biscuits.)
ingredients:
5 lb. tart apples (about 15; such as Granny Smith 
  Braeburn or Winesap) 
  2 c. apple cider 
  apple juice or water 
  2 c. packed brown sugar 
  1 (3-inch) strip lemon peel 
  removed with a vegetable peeler 
  1 Tbsp. ground cinnamon 
  1/4 tsp. each: ground nutmeg and ginger
preparation:
Wash and quarter apples. 
  Put into an 8-quart pot (seeds 
  stems and all) with apple cider. 
  Bring to a boil. 
  Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 
  uncovered 
  stirring occasionally 
  for 30 minutes or until very tender. 
  Put apples through a food mill or sieve set over a large bowl 
  pressing on solids with a spoon. Discard solids. 
  Return puree to pot.

title: Quick Butter Fluff Rolls
ingredients:
1/4 c. warm (not hot) water 
  1 pkg. active dry yeast or 1 cake compressed yeast 
  1 c. butter or sour milk 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1/2 tsp. soda 
  1/4 c. soft shortening 
  2 eggs 
  4 to 4 1/2 c. sifted all-purpose flour
preparation:
Soak yeast in warm water 5 minutes. 
  Combine buttermilk 
  sugar 
  salt 
  soda 
  shortening 
  eggs 
  yeast mixture and half of flour in mixing bowl.

title: Mommy Gnecco'S Chicken Soup For Colds And Flu
ingredients:
1/2 chicken or equivalent pieces with skin 
  1 onion 
  3 to 4 stalks celery with leaves 
  3 carrots 
  2 tsp. chicken bouillon 
  3/4 tsp. dill weed 
  3/4 tsp. dried parsley 
  celery salt to taste 
  salt and pepper (if desired)
preparation:
Variation for day after Thanksgiving: 
  Substitute turkey carcass for chicken.

title: Berniece Camp'S Rice Salad
ingredients:
1 (6 oz.) pkg. chicken flavored rice (Uncle Ben's) 
  1 (6 oz.) jar marinated artichoke hearts 
  1/2 c. mayonnaise 
  2 green onions 
  chopped 
  1/2 c. green pepper 
  chopped 
  8 stuffed olives (medium to large) 
  chopped
preparation:
Cook rice according to directions on package 
  omitting butter. Cool. Toss chopped onions 
  pepper and olives. Drain artichokes 
  reserving marinade. Add marinade to mayonnaise and stir into all other ingredients 
  except artichokes. 
  Coarsely chop artichokes and add last. Salad can be refrigerated and kept for as long as 3 days.

title: Buttery Biscuits
ingredients:
1 stick Blue Bonnet or Parkay margarine 
  2 c. self-rising Gold Medal flour 
  3/4 c. (1% or 2%) milk
preparation:
Preheat oven to 525\u00b0. 
  Have margarine room temperature. 
  Use 1/4 stick to grease a 9-inch round pan. 
  Mix remaining 3/4 stick with the flour and milk. 
  Dough will be very stiff. 
  Mix the minimum amount of time possible. 
  Using two tablespoons 
  dip up rounded tablespoonfuls of dough and push the dough into the pan with back of other spoon. 
  Arrange all the balls of dough in the pan 
  put cold water into the mixing bowl 
  dip spoon in water and shake off excess water. 
  Using back of spoon 
  flatten and smooth each biscuit until they are uniform in size and thickness. 
  Bake 20 minutes. 
  Enjoy while hot!

title: Brownies(Extra Fattening, Bigger Butted Women, Beware!)
ingredients:
1 box German chocolate cake mix with pudding 
  1 can condensed 
  sweetened milk 
  1 bag caramels 
  1 bag chocolate chips 
  1 stick butter 
  1 bag walnuts or pecans
preparation:
Mix 1/2 can of milk 
  butter and cake mix. 
  If the batter is still dry 
  you may add a sprinkle of water. 
  Add the rest of the milk to the caramels and melt in the microwave or a double boiler. Pour 2/3 of the cake mixture into a 13 x 9-inch greased pan and bake 10 minutes in a 350\u00b0 oven. 
  Remove from the oven and add a layer of nuts 
  caramel and chocolate chips. 
  Cover with the remaining cake mixture and bake an additional 20 minutes at 350\u00b0.

title: Tomato And Hamburger Casserole
ingredients:
1 bag egg noodles (8 oz. pkg.) 
  1 1/2 lb. ground beef 
  1 small can tomato sauce 
  1/2 jar Cheez Whiz 
  1/2 c. grated cheese 
  1 tsp. soy sauce
preparation:
Cook egg noodles in water with soy sauce. 
  Cook hamburger in skillet until it is in small pieces. 
  Mix in noodles and hamburger meat; add tomato soup and Cheez Whiz. 
  Put in casserole dish. 
  Add cheese to top. 
  Cook at 350\u00b0 until cheese is melted.

title: Chicken Cacciatore(4 Servings)
ingredients:
3 lb. chicken 
  1/4 c. olive oil 
  1/2 c. chopped onions 
  1 can Italian tomatoes (2 lb. 3 oz.) 
  1/2 c. dry white wine 
  1 tsp. salt 
  1/4 tsp. pepper 
  1/2 bay leaf 
  1/8 tsp. thyme 
  1/4 tsp. marjoram
preparation:
Cut chicken into individual pieces. 
  Saute chicken pieces until golden brown in 1/4 cup olive oil. 
  Add rest of ingredients. Cover the chicken. 
  Simmer it for 1 hour. 
  Remove the cover to permit the sauce to reduce somewhat. 
  Cook the chicken until tender. 
  Serve with boiled spaghetti.
price: I would estimate the cost of this recipe to be a 2.

title: Ranchburgers
ingredients:
6 slices bacon 
  1 1/2 c. grated American cheese 
  2 Tbsp. onion 
  finely chopped 
  1/4 c. catsup 
  1 Tbsp. prepared mustard 
  6 sandwich buns
preparation:
Select corn with fresh 
  green husks. 
  Just before cooking 
  remove husks and silk; cut out any blemishes. 
  Wrap each ear of corn in a square of waxed paper 
  twisting ends tightly. 
  Place in microwave oven with about 1-inch space between ears. 
  Cook on High power (4 ears for approximately 15 to 18 minutes or until tender). Use caution when unwrapping corn 
  as they will remain hot for a time after removing from microwave.

title: Hot Applesauce Cake
ingredients:
4 c. hot applesauce 
  3 c. sugar 
  3 tsp. soda 
  1 1/2 lb. nuts 
  1 1/2 tsp. salt 
  1 1/2 c. shortening 
  6 c. flour 
  1 1/2 lb. raisins 
  3/4 c. cocoa 
  1 tsp. cloves 
  1 tsp. allspice 
  1 tsp. cinnamon
preparation:
Heat applesauce. 
  Melt shortening in applesauce; add sugar 
  dry ingredients 
  nuts and raisins. 
  Bake in greased and floured loaf pans at 325\u00b0 approximately 1 hour. 
  This is an old-timer's recipe. Keeps well and can be frozen.

title: Majestic Layered Spinach Salad
ingredients:
4 c. torn fresh spinach 
  4 hard-boiled eggs 
  sliced 
  2 c. sliced fresh mushrooms 
  1 c. cubed Swiss cheese 
  8 oz. cream cheese 
  softened 
  4 slices bacon 
  crisp fried and crumbled 
  1 c. sour cream 
  3 Tbsp. milk 
  1 1/2 Tbsp. lemon juice 
  2 Tbsp. sugar 
  1/4 c. sliced green onions
preparation:
Layer spinach 
  eggs 
  mushrooms and Swiss cheese in 2-quart bowl. 
  Blend cream cheese 
  sour cream 
  milk 
  lemon juice and sugar in bowl. 
  Stir in green onions. 
  Spread over salad 
  sealing to edge. 
  Chill 
  covered 
  for several hours to overnight. 
  Top with bacon before serving. 
  Makes 8 servings.

title: Shorter Mansion Punch
ingredients:
3 large cans frozen lemonade 
  diluted 
  dry sherry 
  1 to 2 bottles chilled soda water 
  ice ring of lemonade
preparation:
Dilute lemonade as described on the can with dry sherry rather than water. 
  Add soda water as desired. 
  Serve from punch bowl in cups with shaved ice. 
  Ice ring of lemonade is attractive in punch bowl and will not dilute punch.

title: Ginger-Garlic Spicy Chicken
ingredients:
4 cloves garlic 
  minced 
  1 1/2 tsp. grated ginger root 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/2 tsp. pepper 
  1/4 tsp. red pepper 
  1/4 tsp. cinnamon 
  1 Tbsp. catsup 
  1 Tbsp. red wine vinegar 
  1 Tbsp. water
preparation:
Mix all ingredients. 
  Brush both sides of each of 8 chicken breasts with garlic mixture. 
  Place chicken in a shallow baking pan. Bake 
  uncovered 
  in a 375\u00b0 oven for 50 to 55 minutes or until done.

title: Meat Loaf(Sweet And Delicious!)
ingredients:
2 lb. ground beef (lean) 
  1 onion 
  chopped 
  2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce 
  2 eggs 
  1 tsp. salt or Lawry's seasoning 
  sprinkle of pepper 
  1/2 c. catsup 
  1/2 c. brown sugar 
  1 tsp. mustard 
  1/4 c. canned milk 
  sprinkle of parsley
preparation:
Mix all ingredients together and form into a loaf. Place in baking dish. May garnish top with 3 tablespoons each: mustard 
  brown sugar and ketchup 
  mixed together 
  last 15 minutes in oven. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour.

title: Saucy Ham And Potato
ingredients:
2 Tbsp. chopped onion 
  1/4 c. margarine 
  1/4 c. flour 
  1 tsp. salt 
  1/2 tsp. dry mustard 
  dash of pepper 
  1 1/2 c. milk 
  2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese 
  1/2 lb. ham 
  cut into slices 
  6 c. cooked potatoes 
  sliced
preparation:
Saute onion in margarine. 
  Blend in flour and seasonings. Gradually add milk. 
  Cook stirring constantly until thickened. Add cheese. 
  Stir until melted. 
  Toss with potatoes in cheese sauce. 
  Add ham. 
  Pour into 2-quart casserole. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes.
price:
1. 2 Tbsp. chopped onion - 1
2. 1/4 c. margarine - 1
3. 1/4 c. flour - 1
4. 1 tsp. salt - 1
5. 1/2 tsp. dry mustard - 1
6. dash of pepper - 1
7. 1 1/2 c. milk - 1
8. 2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese - 2
9. 1/2 lb. ham, cut into slices - 2
10. 6 c. cooked potatoes, sliced - 1

The estimated cost of this recipe would be a 2, meaning it is moderately expensive.

title: Dot'S Brown Bread
ingredients:
1 lb. raisins 
  2 tsp. baking soda 
  1/4 to 1/2 stick margarine 
  2 c. boiling water 
  2 c. sugar 
  4 c. flour (all-purpose) 
  1 tsp. vanilla 
  2 eggs 
  1 tsp. salt 
  1 tsp. cinnamon 
  1 c. nuts
preparation:
Mix first 4 ingredients together and let stand overnight. 
  Add rest of ingredients 
  blending well 
  and bake in 6 (1 pound) greased coffee cans for 1 hour at 350\u00b0. 
  Cool in cans.

title: Mock Champagne Cocktail
ingredients:
1 (7 oz.) bottle lemon-lime carbonated beverage 
  chilled 
  1/2 c. chilled apple juice 
  3 thin slices lemon
preparation:
Just before serving 
  mix carbonated beverage and apple juice. Serve in stemmed glasses with lemon slice.

title: Great Cornbread
ingredients:
1/2 stick butter 
  1 can creamed corn 
  2 c. cornmeal 
  1 medium onion 
  1 pt. sour cream 
  2 eggs
preparation:
Preheat oven to 375\u00b0. 
  Melt butter in iron skillet. 
  Mix all other ingredients together. 
  Add melted butter and stir. 
  Pour into hot iron skillet. 
  Bake 30 minutes or until center is done.

title: Mother'S Yeast Bread
ingredients:
1 c. milk 
  1/4 c. butter 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1 tsp. salt 
  1 pkg. dry yeast 
  1 c. warm water 
  1 egg 
  4 1/2 c. flour
preparation:
Heat milk 
  butter 
  sugar and salt. 
  Set aside to cool. Sprinkle yeast in cup of warm water. 
  To first mixture 
  add egg 
  then flour and then yeast water. 
  Knead until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a warm place after brushing with melted shortening. Cover and let rise until double in bulk. 
  Knead again and make into two loaves or rolls. 
  Let rise again. 
  Bake at 325\u00b0 about 40 minutes for bread. 
  For rolls 
  bake at 375\u00b0 until lightly brown.

title: Swiss Chard Saute
ingredients:
1 Tbsp. olive oil 
  1 large onion 
  chopped 
  2 cloves garlic 
  finely chopped 
  1 1/4 lb. Swiss chard 
  washed and patted dry 
  steamed 
  torn and packed (4 c.) 
  1 Tbsp. water 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/4 tsp. ground black pepper
preparation:
Heat oil in skillet over moderate heat. 
  Saute onion and garlic for 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is tender. 
  Reduce heat to low. 
  Add Swiss chard 
  water 
  salt and pepper; stir well. Cover and simmer 
  stirring occasionally for 5 to 8 minutes or until chard is wilted and tender.
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is sour.

title: The "Best" Cake Icing
ingredients:
1 c. milk 
  5 Tbsp. flour 
  1 c. sugar 
  1 c. soft butter 
  1 tsp. vanilla
preparation:
In shaker or jar 
  blend until smooth the milk and flour. 
  Cook until thick 
  stirring constantly. 
  Mixture will be very thick. Cool. 
  Cream remaining ingredients together until light and fluffy with mixer in a medium sized bowl. 
  Gradually add cooled milk/flour mixture to sugar/butter while beating at high speed until all sugar granules are dissolved. 
  Ready to frost cooled cake.

title: Heavenly Hash Fudge Cake
ingredients:
1 stick margarine 
  1 block unsweetened chocolate 
  2 eggs 
  1 c. sugar
preparation:
Melt oleo and chocolate over low heat. 
  Add eggs and sugar. Add to chocolate mixture; then add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 cup chopped pecans. 
  Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan. 
  Bake at 300\u00b0 to 325\u00b0 for 30 minutes. 
  Put on marshmallows.

title: Chocolate Crack Cookies
ingredients:
4 sq. (4 oz.) unsweetened chocolate 
  1/2 c. salad oil 
  4 eggs 
  unbeaten 
  2 c. sifted flour 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1 c. powdered sugar (approximately) 
  2 c. sugar 
  2 tsp. vanilla 
  2 tsp. baking powder 
  1/2 c. walnuts
preparation:
Melt chocolate in a large double boiler or a mixing bowl over hot water. 
  Remove from water and blend in oil and sugar. 
  Add eggs 
  one at a time 
  and beat well after each addition. 
  Add vanilla. 
  Sift together flour 
  baking powder and salt. 
  Stir into chocolate mixture. 
  Add nuts and mix thoroughly. 
  Chill soft dough for several hours or overnight.

title: Daisy'S Pancake
ingredients:
1/2 c. flour 
  1/2 c. milk 
  dash of salt 
  2 eggs 
  1/4 cube butter or margarine
preparation:
Combine flour 
  milk and salt. 
  Add slightly beaten eggs. 
  Stir to mix ingredients only. 
  Mixture will be lumpy. 
  Pour into small ovenproof skillet in which butter has melted. 
  Bake 15 minutes at 425\u00b0. 
  Sprinkle with lemon juice and powdered sugar. 
  Serve with orange marmalade. 
  Serves 2.

title: Grannies Doughnuts
ingredients:
1/2 c. mashed potatoes 
  3/4 c. sugar 
  1 egg 
  1/2 c. milk 
  2 c. flour 
  2 1/2 tsp. baking powder 
  1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/2 tsp. nutmeg 
  powdered sugar
preparation:
Combine potatoes 
  sugar 
  egg and milk in a bowl. 
  Sift the flour 
  baking powder 
  salt and nutmeg together and stir into the sugar mixture. 
  Roll out on a floured surface and cut with a doughnut cutter. 
  Drop into deep 
  hot fat and fry until golden brown. 
  Drain and roll in powdered sugar. 
  Makes 3 dozen.

title: Marsetti Casserole
ingredients:
1 lb. ground beef 
  2 Tbsp. fat 
  3 large onions 
  1 can tomato sauce 
  1 (8 oz.) pkg. fine noodles 
  cooked a little 
  1/2 lb. grated Cheddar cheese 
  3 stalks celery 
  diced 
  1 1/2 green peppers 
  diced 
  1 can spaghetti sauce 
  1 tsp. sugar
preparation:
Brown beef; push to side. 
  Add celery 
  onions and green peppers. 
  Cook until tender. 
  Add sauce 
  tomato sauce 
  sugar and noodles. 
  Place in casserole. 
  Sprinkle with cheese. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour.

title: Mrs. Gilpin'S Fruit Cake
ingredients:
2 c. white sugar 
  1 c. butter 
  3 c. flour 
  whites of 8 eggs 
  2 c. nuts 
  candied cherries 
  citron 
  pineapple 
  orange and lemon peel 
  2 tsp. baking powder 
  1 lb. raisins (I omit raisins and use more dates and figs) 
  1 lb. dates 
  1 lb. figs
preparation:
Dredge fruit in 1 cup of flour. 
  Add 1 cup wine or whiskey. Bake in slow oven.
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory (umami).

title: Green Beans And Potatoes Greek Style
ingredients:
1/4 c. extra virgin olive oil or enough to cover bottom of pot 
  1 medium onion 
  diced 
  1 1/2 lb. fresh green beans 
  snapped 
  2 lb. Yokon Gold potatoes or your choice 
  2 cans tomato sauce 
  2 cans water 
  salt to taste 
  pepper to taste
preparation:
In large pot 
  saute onion in olive oil until transparent. 
  Add the green beans and potatoes 
  that have been quartered 
  then cut in half. 
  Add the tomato sauce and water. 
  Cover and cook until tender. 
  Add salt and pepper.

title: Spanish Rice And Hamburger
ingredients:
2 small onions 
  chopped 
  1 green pepper 
  chopped 
  3 Tbsp. oil 
  1 lb. hamburger 
  1 1/2 tsp. salt 
  1/4 tsp. pepper 
  1 tsp. chili powder 
  4 c. cooked rice 
  2 c. tomatoes
preparation:
Saute onions and pepper in fat until brown. 
  Add hamburger 
  salt 
  pepper and chili powder. 
  When meat is slightly brown 
  place alternate layers of rice and meat mixture in casserole. 
  Pour tomatoes over dish and bake at 375\u00b0 for 50 minutes.

title: Frank'S Favorite Date Cake
ingredients:
8 oz. or 1 c. dates 
  cut up 
  1 c. boiling water 
  1/2 c. shortening 
  1/2 c. white sugar 
  1/2 c. brown sugar 
  1 egg 
  1 tsp. vanilla 
  1 2/3 c. flour 
  1/2 tsp. soda 
  1 tsp. baking powder 
  1/4 tsp. salt 
  1/2 c. walnuts 
  chopped
preparation:
Pour water over dates. 
  Set aside; let cool. 
  Combine shortening 
  sugars 
  egg and vanilla. 
  Add cooled date mix. 
  Add remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly. 
  Pour into buttered 9 x 13-inch pan. 
  Bake at 350\u00b0 for 40 to 45 minutes. 
  Best with Brown Sugar Icing.

title: Apricot Pecan Squares
ingredients:
2/3 c. dried apricots 
  1/2 c. butter 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1 c. sifted flour 
  2 eggs 
  beat slightly 
  1 c. brown sugar 
  packed 
  1/3 c. sifted flour 
  1/2 tsp. baking powder 
  salt (optional) 
  1/2 tsp. vanilla 
  1 c. pecans
preparation:
Cover apricots with water and boil 10 minutes; drain. 
  Cool. Cut in small pieces (scissors). 
  Cream butter and sugar; add 1 cup flour. 
  Pat firmly in ungreased 7 x 11-inch pan (put flour on hands). 
  Bake 25 minutes at 350\u00b0 (light brown). 
  Blend eggs and brown sugar. 
  Add additional flour 
  baking powder and vanilla; blend. 
  Add apricots and pecans. 
  Spread carefully over already cooked mixture and bake 30 minutes at 350\u00b0. 
  Cool. 
  Sprinkle powdered sugar on top. 
  Cut in bars.

title: Butter Orange Fluff
ingredients:
1 stick butter (1/4 lb.) 
  1/2 c. brown sugar 
  1 tsp. grated orange rind
preparation:
Cream butter until light and fluffy. 
  Add brown sugar gradually 
  beating to a light 
  fluffy mass. 
  Stir in orange rind. Serve on pancakes or waffles instead of syrup.

title: Johnny'S Navy Dressing
ingredients:
apple cider vinegar 
  white sugar 
  Crisco oil 
  ketchup
preparation:
Mix equal parts of vinegar 
  sugar 
  oil and ketchup. 
  Shake well and serve over your salad. 
  To use this recipe for slaw 
  delete ketchup.

title: Chic-Olie Bake
ingredients:
8 stewed and boned chicken breasts 
  2 (10 oz.) pkg. broccoli 
  cooked and drained 
  3 cans cream of chicken soup 
  1 1/2 c. mayonnaise or Miracle Whip 
  1/2 c. Romano or Parmesan cheese 
  1/2 c. bread crumbs 
  1 Tbsp. margarine or butter 
  2 c. cooked rice or noodles
preparation:
Combine soup and mayonnaise. 
  On bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan 
  spread rice or noodles. 
  Then in this order layer following ingredients: 
  broccoli 
  half of the soup and mayonnaise mixture 
  chicken and other half of soup and mayonnaise mixture. 
  Sprinkle with cheese and then bake for 1 hour at 300\u00b0.

title: White Chocolate Drops
ingredients:
1/2 c. butter Crisco 
  2 eggs 
  1/2 c. sugar 
  1 tsp. vanilla 
  1 c. (6 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate pieces 
  melted 
  1 c. Quaker oats 
  uncooked 
  3/4 c. all-purpose flour 
  1 tsp. baking powder 
  1/2 c. white chocolate
preparation:
Heat oven to 350\u00b0. 
  Mix the first 4 ingredients until smooth. Add melted chocolate. 
  Mix well. Stir in combined dry ingredients and white chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 7 to 9 minutes until cookies are almost set.

title: Leatha'S Sour Cream Sugar Cookies
ingredients:
1 c. brown sugar 
  1 c. white sugar 
  1 c. shortening 
  2 eggs 
  1 c. sour cream 
  1 tsp. soda 
  2 tsp. baking powder 
  4 c. flour 
  1 1/2 tsp. vanilla 
  1 tsp. nutmeg
preparation:
Cream the shortening and sugars. Add eggs and beat well. 
  Sift 1 cup flour. 
  Add soda 
  baking powder and nutmeg to flour. 
  Stir into shortening and sugar mixture. 
  Mix well. 
  Stir in sour cream and the rest of the flour. Chill for 1 hour. 
  Roll out and cut with cookie cutter. 
  Bake at 400\u00b0 for about 12 minutes.

title: Nana'S Peas(My Favorite)
ingredients:
2 bags frozen peas 
  2 Tbsp. butter 
  1 pt. half and half cream 
  salt and pepper to taste 
  flour (to thicken)
preparation:
Cook peas 
  butter 
  salt and pepper together until tender. 
  Add half and half cream to this. 
  When bubbling again 
  thicken to gravy stage with water and flour thickener.

title: Pink Velvet Pie
ingredients:
16 graham crackers 
  crushed fine 
  4 Tbsp. butter 
  melted 
  1 pkg. strawberry gelatin 
  1/2 c. hot water 
  1/4 c. lemon juice 
  1/4 c. sugar 
  1 tall can chilled Carnation milk 
  1 tsp. lemon rind 
  grated
preparation:
Mix graham crackers with butter and line deep 9-inch pie plate 
  saving 1/4 cup of mixture for topping. 
  Dissolve gelatin in hot water. 
  Add lemon juice and sugar and let stand while whipping Carnation milk to a stiff froth. 
  Add gelatin mixture to whipped milk and continue whipping until stiff peak forms. 
  Stir in lemon rind. 
  Pour in crust. 
  Top with remaining crumbs. 
  Chill 4 hours or until firm. 
  Serves 6 to 8.

title: Quick Banana Split Cake
ingredients:
vanilla wafers 
  1 large pkg. instant vanilla pudding 
  1 large tub whipped topping 
  4 to 5 bananas 
  1 large can crushed pineapple 
  drained 
  nuts 
  cherries
preparation:
First 
  cover bottom of a 9 x 13-inch dish with whole vanilla wafers.

title: Strawberry Pudding Desserts
ingredients:
1 (10 oz.) pkg. angel food cake 
  10 oz. fresh or frozen strawberries 
  4 oz. Cool Whip 
  5 oz. pkg. vanilla pudding (instant or regular)
preparation:
Tear angel food cake into pieces. 
  Put in 9 x 13-inch pan. Make pudding as directed on package. 
  Fold in Cool Whip. 
  Pour over angel food cake. 
  Next 
  fold in strawberries. 
  Refrigerate until ready to eat.

title: Beef And Cheddar Macaroni
ingredients:
1 lb. ground beef 
  1 onion 
  chopped 
  2 tsp. butter 
  1 jar spaghetti sauce (15 oz.) 
  1 (8 oz.) elbow macaroni 
  cooked 
  1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese 
  4 oz. mushrooms 
  drained 
  1 tsp. basil 
  1/2 tsp. garlic powder 
  1/2 tsp. oregano 
  salt and pepper
preparation:
Brown beef and onions. 
  Drain fat. 
  In a large bowl 
  combine beef and onion 
  spaghetti sauce 
  macaroni 
  1 cup cheese 
  mushrooms 
  basil 
  garlic powder 
  oregano 
  salt and pepper. 
  Bake 
  covered 
  at 350\u00b0 
  for 20 minutes. 
  Sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese and bake 5 minutes more or until cheese melts.

title: Homemade Za'Atar
ingredients:
3 tablespoons sesame seeds 
  3 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves 
  1 tablespoon sumac powder 
  1/2 teaspoon salt
preparation:
Toast sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat until just golden 
  about 3 to 5 minutes. 
  Combine sesame seeds 
  thyme leaves 
  sumac 
  and salt in a bowl and stir until well combined.

title: Chicken Lasagna Ii
ingredients:
6 lasagne noodles 
  cooked and drained 
  1 pound ground chicken 
  1/2 cup chopped onion 
  1/2 cup chopped green bell pepper 
  1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup 
  1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup 
  1 (5 ounce) can evaporated milk 
  1 pound shredded mozzarella cheese 
  1 (8 ounce) container cottage cheese
preparation:
Cook lasagna noodles in boiling salted water until al dente. Rinse with cool water 
  drain well. 
  In a large skillet 
  cook and stir ground turkey or chicken 
  chopped onions and green pepper over medium heat until golden brown. Drain excess grease. Mix in cream of mushroom soup 
  cream of chicken soup 
  and evaporated skim milk. Cook mixture until it comes to a low boil. 
  To assemble 
  in a buttered 13x9 inch casserole dish layer 1/2 cup of the sauce 
  3 lasagna noodles 
  1/2 cup of sauce 
  cottage cheese 
  one half of the shredded mozzarella cheese 
  3 noodles 
  remaining sauce mixture. Finish with remaining shredded mozzarella cheese. 
  In a preheated 350 degree F(175 degree C) oven bake for 45 to 60 minutes. Cook until heated through and bubbly. Let stand for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is sweet.

title: Guilty Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients:
1 cup butter flavored shortening 
  3/4 cup white sugar 
  3/4 cup brown sugar 
  2 eggs 
  1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
  2 cups all-purpose flour 
  1/2 teaspoon baking powder 
  1 teaspoon salt 
  2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
preparation:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets. 
  In a large bowl 
  cream together the butter flavored shortening 
  white sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs 
  one at a time then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour 
  baking powder and salt; stir into the creamed mixture. Adjust the amount of chocolate chips to your liking 
  then stir them in by hand using a wooden spoon. Drop dough by heaping spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Clumps of dough should be about 3 inches apart. 
  Bake for 7 minutes in the preheated oven 
  until brown around the edges. Let cool for 20 minutes. Eat and enjoy!
cooking_style: No cooking style, this is a no-bake recipe.

title: Really Creamy Fettuccine Alfredo
ingredients:
8 ounces dry fettuccine pasta 
  1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese 
  3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
  1/2 cup margarine 
  1/2 cup milk 
  1 teaspoon garlic powder 
  1/4 teaspoon dried basil 
  1 pinch ground nutmeg
preparation:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain. 
  In a medium saucepan 
  combine cream cheese 
  Parmesan 
  margarine 
  milk 
  garlic powder and basil and stir over low heat until smooth and creamy 
  10 to 15 minutes. Toss sauce with pasta and sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve.

title: Out Of This World Turkey Brine
ingredients:
2 gallons water 
  1 1/2 cups canning salt 
  3 tablespoons minced garlic 
  1 tablespoon ground black pepper 
  1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce 
  1/3 cup brown sugar
preparation:
In a food-grade large bucket or container large enough to hold your turkey 
  mix together the water 
  salt 
  garlic 
  pepper 
  Worcestershire sauce and brown sugar. Store in a refrigerator 
  and soak turkey for 2 days before smoking or roasting.

title: Petra'S Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients:
2 pounds fresh strawberries 
  sliced 
  1 cup white sugar 
  1 cup all-purpose flour 
  2 tablespoons cornstarch 
  1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder 
  5 eggs 
  separated 
  1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
  1 1/4 cups white sugar 
  1 cup heavy cream 
  2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar
preparation:
Place the sliced strawberries into a mixing bowl and stir in 1 cup of sugar. Cover 
  and refrigerate 2 hours to overnight. Stir the strawberries occasionally. The longer they sit in the syrup 
  the more syrup you will have. 
  Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking dish. Whisk the flour together with cornstarch 
  and baking powder in a mixing bowl. 
  Beat the egg yolks in a small bowl with the vanilla extract until smooth; set aside. Whip the egg whites with an electric mixer until very stiff. Slowly add the 1 1/4 cup sugar to the egg whites 
  a few tablespoons at a time 
  until the sugar is incorporated and the whites are stiff. Fold in the yolk mixture until almost fully blended into the whites. Fold in the flour mixture until just combined. A few small lumps of flour should remain. Scrape the batter into the prepared baking dish. 
  Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean 
  22 to 25 minutes. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes 
  then invert the cake onto a sheet of waxed paper 
  and cut into 8 equal pieces. While the cake is cooling 
  whip the heavy cream with the confectioners' sugar to soft peaks. 
  To assemble the strawberry shortcakes: cut each cake square in half horizontally 
  and put the bottom halves onto dessert plates. Spoon on the strawberries and syrup 
  then top with the cake tops. Spoon on whipped cream to serve.
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory (umami).

title: Creamed Carrot Strips
ingredients:
3/4 cup water 
  1 cube chicken bouillon 
  1 pound carrots 
  peeled and julienned 
  2 tablespoons butter 
  1 cup chopped celery 
  1 (4.5 ounce) can mushrooms 
  drained 
  1/4 cup chopped onion 
  2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 
  1/4 teaspoon salt 
  1/4 teaspoon dried tarragon 
  1 dash black pepper 
  2/3 cup milk
preparation:
Heat water in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Dissolve bouillon in hot water and add carrots; cover and boil gently for 10 minutes. 
  Meanwhile 
  melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute celery 
  mushrooms and onion until tender. Stir in flour 
  salt 
  tarragon and pepper. Gradually stir in milk and carrots with the broth they were boiled in. 
  Cook over medium heat 
  stirring occasionally 
  until mixture comes to a boil and thickens.

title: Fran'S Angel Food Pie
ingredients:
2 cups water 
  1 pinch salt 
  1 cup white sugar 
  1/4 cup cornstarch 
  3 large egg whites 
  1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
  1 (9 inch) baked pie shell 
  1 pint heavy cream 
  whipped 
  1 teaspoon white sugar 
  or to taste 
  1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract 
  or to taste 
  1 tablespoon chopped walnuts
preparation:
Partially fill the bottom of a double boiler with water 
  and bring the water to a boil. Pour 2 cups of water into the top of the double boiler with the salt. Place the top of the boiler onto the bottom. Whisk 1 cup of sugar with the cornstarch in a bowl until all lumps are gone 
  and whisk the mixture into the water until smooth. Cook 
  whisking constantly 
  until the mixture is thickened and translucent. 
  In a large bowl 
  beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until they form stiff peaks. Pour in the hot cornstarch mixture in a slow 
  steady stream 
  beating constantly 
  until the mixture is fluffy and forms peaks. Beat in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Spread the filling into the baked pie shell in an even layer 
  and chill in refrigerator. 
  With an electric mixer 
  beat the cream with 1 teaspoon of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract in a large metal bowl until the cream forms soft peaks; frost the pie with decorative swirls and peaks of the whipped cream. Sprinkle pie with chopped walnuts. Refrigerate until serving time.

title: Chocolate Bundt® Cake
ingredients:
1 (18.25 ounce) package chocolate cake mix 
  1 (16 ounce) container sour cream 
  1 (5.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix 
  1/3 cup vegetable oil 
  1/2 cup brewed coffee 
  3 eggs 
  1 (6 ounce) package chocolate chunks
preparation:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter and flour a 10-inch fluted tube pan (such as Bundt(R)). 
  Mix cake mix 
  sour cream 
  pudding mix 
  vegetable oil 
  coffee 
  and eggs together in a bowl; fold in chocolate chunks. Pour batter into the prepared pan. 
  Bake in the preheated oven until cake springs back when lightly touched 
  65 to 75 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Slice cake and microwave each piece for 10 seconds to serve.

title: Creamy Biscuits And Gravy
ingredients:
Biscuits: 
  2 cups all-purpose flour 
  4 teaspoons baking powder 
  1 tablespoon white sugar 
  1/2 teaspoon salt 
  1/2 cup shortening 
  1 egg 
  beaten 
  2/3 cup milk 
  1 tablespoon butter 
  melted 
  Gravy: 
  1 (16 ounce) package bulk pork breakfast sausage (such as Jimmy Dean(R)) 
  1/4 cup butter 
  1/4 cup all-purpose flour 
  1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk 
  1 1/2 cups water 
  salt and ground black pepper to taste
preparation:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet. 
  Whisk 2 cups flour 
  baking powder 
  sugar 
  and salt together in a bowl; cut shortening into flour mixture with a pastry cutter until mixture is crumbly. Mix in egg and milk until incorporated. Turn dough out onto a well-floured work surface and knead for 1 minute. 
  Roll dough out to a thickness of 3/4 to 1-inch thick 
  cut with a biscuit cutter 
  and place biscuits onto prepared baking sheet. Brush tops of biscuits with melted butter. 
  Bake in the preheated oven until biscuits are golden brown 
  8 to 10 minutes. 
  Cook and stir sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly 
  about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease. Stir 1/4 cup butter into sausage until butter has melted and mix in 1/4 cup flour until thoroughly combined. Pour evaporated milk and water into sausage mixture 
  bring gravy to a simmer 
  and reduce heat to low; simmer gravy until thickened 
  about 5 minutes. Season gravy with salt and black pepper to taste. 
  Serve biscuits with sausage gravy.

title: Greek Yogurt Parmesan Chicken
ingredients:
1 cup plain Greek yogurt 
  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
  1/4 cup panko bread crumbs 
  or as needed 
  1/2 (1 ounce) package ranch dressing mix 
  1 teaspoon garlic powder 
  1 teaspoon prepared yellow mustard 
  or to taste (optional) 
  1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper 
  3 small skinless 
  boneless chicken breast halves 
  pounded 1/2-inch thick
preparation:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 
  Stir yogurt 
  Parmesan cheese 
  bread crumbs 
  ranch dressing mix 
  garlic powder 
  mustard 
  and pepper together in a bowl. Spread yogurt mixture over each chicken breast to coat completely. Transfer coated chicken to a baking dish. 
  Bake chicken in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Turn on the oven's broiler. 
  Broil chicken 
  turning once 
  until bread crumbs are toasted 
  and chicken breasts are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear 
  2 to 4 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

title: Salted Caramel Nut Brittle
ingredients:
Reynolds Wrap(R) Non Stick Aluminum Foil 
  1 cup butter 
  1 cup sugar 
  3 tablespoons water 
  1 tablespoon light-color corn syrup 
  1/3 cup lightly salted roasted cashews 
  coarsely chopped 
  1/3 cup almonds 
  toasted and coarsely chopped 
  1/4 cup roasted and salted pumpkin seeds 
  2 tablespoons sesame seeds 
  toasted
preparation:
Line a 15x10x1-inch baking pan with Reynolds Wrap(R) Non-Stick Foil; set aside. 
  Melt the butter in a 2-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir in sugar 
  water and corn syrup. Bring to boiling over medium-high heat 
  stirring until sugar is dissolved. Avoid splashing side of saucepan. Clip a candy thermometer to side of pan. Cook over medium heat 
  stirring frequently 
  until thermometer registers 290 degrees F or a small amount of mixture dropped into very cold water separates into threads that are hard but not brittle. This will take about 18 minutes. Adjust heat as necessary to maintain a steady boil. Watch carefully the last 5 minutes to prevent overcooking. Remove from heat and remove the thermometer. 
  Pour into the prepared baking pan. Tilt pan to spread mixture evenly. Let stand 2 minutes. In a small bowl combine the cashews 
  almonds 
  pumpkin seeds 
  and sesame seeds. Sprinkle evenly over candy mixture. 
  Set baking pan on a wire rack. Cool completely and break into large pieces to serve.

title: No-Headache Holiday Sauce
ingredients:
12 ounces fresh cranberries 
  1/2 cup water 
  3 cups Gala or Rome apples 
  peeled and chopped coarsely 
  2 Bartlett pears 
  peeled and chopped coarsely 
  4 tablespoons sugar 
  or to taste 
  4 teaspoons cinnamon
preparation:
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Cover and simmer 
  stirring occasionally 
  until cranberries pop 
  25-30 minutes. Cool to room temperature or chill.

title: Lemon Tabouli
ingredients:
2 cups bulgur 
  4 cups boiling water 
  3 tablespoons olive oil 
  2 lemons 
  zested 
  2 lemons 
  juiced 
  1/4 cup chopped fresh mint 
  1/4 cup minced fresh parsley 
  salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
In a large bowl 
  pour boiling water over bulgur. Stir in olive oil 
  lemon zest 
  lemon juice 
  mint 
  and parsley. Set aside for 30 minutes. 
  Fluff bulgur with a fork 
  and season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Asian Turkey Barbecue On Sesame Scallion Toasts
ingredients:
1/3 cup hoisin sauce 
  1/4 cup barbeque sauce 
  1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root 
  2 tablespoons sesame oil 
  divided 
  3 cups cooked 
  chopped turkey meat 
  salt and pepper to taste 
  1/2 cup diced green onions 
  divided 
  4 English muffins 
  split
preparation:
Preheat the broiler. 
  In a large saucepan over medium heat 
  whisk together hoisin sauce 
  barbeque sauce 
  ginger and 1 tablespoon sesame oil. Mix in turkey 
  salt 
  pepper and green onions 
  gently tossing until all ingredients are well blended. Cook approximately 10 minutes. 
  In a small bowl 
  mix the remaining sesame oil and remaining green onions. Brush the cut sides of the English muffins lightly with the mixture. Place the muffin halves face up on a medium baking sheet. 
  Broil English muffins 2 minutes 
  or until lightly toasted. Remove from heat and top with turkey mixture. Serve warm.

title: Zucchini Fettuccine With Cauliflower Alfredo And Peas
ingredients:
1 head cauliflower 
  broken into florets 
  4 zucchinis 
  ends trimmed 
  2 tablespoons vegetable oil 
  or as needed 
  2 cloves garlic 
  minced 
  1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk 
  1 lemon 
  juiced 
  2 tablespoons flax seeds 
  1 teaspoon dried parsley 
  1 teaspoon dried basil 
  3/4 teaspoon kosher salt 
  1/2 teaspoon ground white pepper 
  1/2 teaspoon peeled and grated fresh turmeric root 
  1/4 teaspoon sriracha sauce
